mutants.code:
import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v - np.dot(v, q) * q
        Q[:, i] = v * np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v - np.dot(v, q) * q
        Q[:, i] = v // np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v + np.dot(v, q) * q
        Q[:, i] = v / np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v * (np.dot(v, q) * q)
        Q[:, i] = v / np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v - np.dot(v, q) / q
        Q[:, i] = v / np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v - (np.dot(v, q) + q)
        Q[:, i] = v / np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q

import numpy as np

def gram_schmidt_process(A):
    """
    Applies the Gram-Schmidt process to transform a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.

    Parameters:
    A (2D list): A matrix where each column is a feature vector.

    Returns:
    Q (2D list): The orthogonal matrix where the vectors are normalized to have a length of 1.
    """
    Q = np.zeros_like(A, dtype=float)
    for (i, v) in enumerate(A.T):
        for j in range(i):
            q = Q[:, j]
            v = v - np.dot(v, q) ** q
        Q[:, i] = v / np.linalg.norm(v)
    return Q
